events.message: The customer submitted a claim after their vehicle was involved in a collision at a busy intersection, causing front bumper damage.
The claim was categorised as an Auto Accident based on the description and the keywords found in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and begin communication regarding next steps.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment message confirming receipt of the claim and expressing commitment to assist.
The company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, a copy of the police report, and repair estimates from an authorized garage.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos, the police report, and a detailed repair estimate for review.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted the third-party involved to verify details.
Investigation concluded confirming liability on the third party, and damage assessments were verified as consistent with the accident.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount to cover the vehicle repair costs and ancillary expenses related to the accident.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed gratitude for the efficient handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance manager after the customer’s acceptance of the settlement offer.
Payment covering the repair costs was issued to the insured party’s nominated account to facilitate timely vehicle restoration.
The insurance claim was formally closed following full settlement payment and confirmation that the vehicle repairs were completed.
All documents and records related to this auto accident claim have been archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
